reviewText:
Early on, you arrive at the rain-soaked border of 'Ghost Town'. That's what's on the sign. In its own way, it's really trying to warn you. Not about ghosts; there aren't any here, just enormous skinless women, but that this entire game is about as original and well thought out as calling your setting 'Ghost Town'.
There's nothing to do here. The biggest challenge you'll face is collecting the notes that are nailed to the walls, in spite of the Skinless Sisters' ability to murder you through them. Deciphering the notes is also a fun distraction. It seems more and then look in the hopper" reads one. Such poetry.
It's not worth money in any currency I can think of. Feel free to check out my bemused reaction to it below.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nLlb1f7Fruo"

reviewText:
The Note's store description is a misleading piece describing how a man has gone missing in the town regarded as SCP-599 leaving only a few notes behind: you're tasked with gathering said research notes and finding the guy.
Too bad not only the actual game has nothing to do with the actual town described in the SCP wiki but is also just one of the countless poory made Slender clones that have been flooding game stores for years.

PROS:

-the soundtrack is somewhat decent

CONS:

-misleading store description, any reference to the SCP universe is completely squandered by the actual gameplay

-poor graphics, washed out colours, ugly textures

-lots of clipping everywhere, it's so bad you can even see through walls if you push against them

-below average sound effects

-awkward movement

-the notes you're supposed to gather will sometimes bug out

-uninspired, unthreatening enemy design

-lacks any kind of atmosphere

-cheap deaths

-broken English

-extremely linear and short

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=522732665

The original SCP-599  was an eerie town inhabited by people resembling those described in missing reports: the small town you'll explore in the game is made up of a few completely empty houses and 2/3 funny looking enemies loitering around. Said enemies have a sort of death aura and you'll die whenever one gets too close to you, even through walls thus leading to some frustrating deaths: their AI is super simple and, the rare times they'll try to slowly walk towards you, just ducking out of view will quickly make them lose interest.

You'll have to gather a certain amount of notes, said notes are supposed to be research left behind by the man you're looking for but between the broken English and simple, nonsense phrases ( what the heck is it seems to me that what I saw" supposed to mean?) they just resemble something written by a 4yo. The notes also seem to always spawn in the same place so getting them will be easy once you know where they are: I had at least two notes bugging out though and I had to get near them and pick them up a second time before they finally disappeared.

If you can survive this dull exercise in frustration you'll have to do the same in an hospital: this part was even easier since there was only two floors with a monster each and both of them followed a very simple patrol route: once that's done you'll enter the final area and get the ending.

It took me 30 minutes to finish the game (including retries in the town area) and
recommended: I can safely say there's really nothing going for it. The overall production values are very low
hoursPlayed: heck there's not even a death animation
voteText: the actual gameplay is awkward and lacks challenge once you learn how to avoid the cheap deaths and there's no sense of menace whatsoever as you travel through the bare environments. If you're looking for a Slender clone there's many better games out there
helpfulPercent: if you want SCP games there's some good ones for free: either way avoid this one."

reviewText:
I guess the moral of the story is:  don't go searching for a friend, because it will end really bad for you.

I have to give credit to the character you play as.  He shows up at a town named Ghost Town.  It's abandoned except for ugly looking beastly things patroling the town, and you don't even make a peep or any sound of surprise.  No, you go around collecting notes stuck on walls that make zero sense, and for some odd reason you have to collect the notes before deciding to go to the hospital, where you know your friend is at, and eventually you go there to end up collecting more notes before you decide to use the elevator.  If that was me, I'd be at the start of the game fixing my car so I can leave asap.  F-ck that noise.

This is a good example of a developer who has no bright ideas or developed skill for making games.  This was obviously a beginner's project.  Don't expect much.  Not even the notes have much.  I still don't understand what the notes were saying.

I'm only recommending it because it does produce a creepy vibe, and I got a couple of jump scares and lingering creepiness from it.  And the running is excellent.  I managed to run up a mountain right up to its apex, in seconds.  Too bad there's no jumping and I had to run around the sidewalk to the sidewalk-ramp in order to get onto the sidewalk.  =(

reviewText:
Started the game, ran to a gas station, found a gas can, could not pick it up. I ran into town, saw a tall snork-looking thing, it ran towards me, my screen went slenderman, died.

Spawned in a second time, ran around the town, came in the back way, snork took me by supprise around the corner, died.

Spawned again, named the snork Mark. Mark and I do not get along well and our limited times of contact do not end well. I am trying to find notes to gain clues to the storyline but Mark likes to make my screen go slenderman. Mark killed me again.

Wanted to give Mark another chance, turns out Mark is not the only snork, he has other snork friends. They run really fast. I ran into a building, found a note, it gave me no hope, I was then found by Mark.

Never trust Mark 9/10

reviewText:
I bought this game the first day it came out. I quickly realized that this game was just the creation of some russian guy looking to make some easy cash. By using some nice screenshots, a somewhat promising game description and an honestly downright intriguing game cover image, he was able to trick myself and many others into buying a complete lie.
This game is not as advertised, do not buy it.
On a side note:
3,537 people bought this game.
This was at a price of $5.99 .
So, for the half ♥♥♥♥♥ effort this guy put into making this game, he made roughly $21186.
Those figures truly sicken me.

Well That's a game! :D

+ : you are damn fast. like really. fast.

- : unfortunately - everything else. Buggy, broken, you can get stuck, i was killed out of nowhere, simple story,

but man, you are fast. It's not worth 6 euro tho. It's worth like 0 euro. if it was free to play, like an experiment i would say, alright. But now i have to put thumb down

2/10 would not run again.
Finished the game in under half an hour. Broken English and generally awful gameplay! Glad I got this in a bundle!
